intro: Ancylobothrys mammosa, commonly known as the hairy bladderworts, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and ditches. Its leaves are simple and often submerged, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. Ancylobothrys mammosa plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling through its carnivorous behavior.
